For the Buddhas have no such thing as a teaching of the Dhamma done without respect. For the Buddhas conduct themselves like lions. Just as a lion makes the same effort to catch a huge elephant or a small mouse, so too the Buddhas teach the Dhamma with the same respect whether they are teaching one person or two or many, whether it be an assembly of bhikkhus or bhikkhunis or laymen or laywomen, or whether it be the sectarians. But the four assemblies listen with faith and respect, and so their teaching of the Dhamma comes to be called a teaching done with respect.
